intro: Conioselinum fischeri, commonly known as Fischer's wormwood, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
